intro: Hieracium rauzense subsp. cernaeglavae, commonly known as the Cernaeglava hawkweed, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces seeds in a fluffy, wind-dispersed manner. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
